title: Test
yAxis: Infant mortality per 1,000 live born children
summary: This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Infant mortality per 1,000 live born children, with a total of 11 data points.
Overall Infant mortality per 1,000 live born children has decreased over the Year.

Infant mortality per 1,000 live born children is roughly constant from 2008 to 2010, slightly decreasing from 2010 to 2011, slightly increasing from 2011 to 2012, gradually decreasing from 2012 to 2015, slightly increasing from 2015 to 2016, and lastly roughly decreasing from 2016 to 2018.
The steepest decrease occurs in between the Year 2014 and 2015.
Max Infant mortality per 1,000 live born children about 3.8 was recorded at Year 2008,  2009,  2010, and 2013
Min Infant mortality per 1,000 live born children about 3.3 was recorded at Year 2015
This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Infant mortality per 1,000 live born children, with a total of 11 data points. The chart has 6 significant trends.
The longest trend is extremely increasing which exists from 2015 to 2017.
Additionally, the next significant trend is slightly decreasing which exists from 2013 to 2015.
Contrarily, the next significant trend is extremely increasing which exists from 2011 to 2013.
Also, the next significant trend is moderately constant which exists from 2008 to 2010.
On the other hand, the next significant trend is moderately decreasing which exists from 2017 to 2018.
On the other hand, the next significant trend is slightly decreasing which exists from 2010 to 2011.
